remarks: Deduce the predicate "is a trace-preserving endomorphism".  (Contributed by NM, 9-Jun-2013.)
statement:
tendoset.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
tendoset.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
tendoset.t $e |- T = ( ( LTrn ` K ) ` W ) $.
tendoset.r $e |- R = ( ( trL ` K ) ` W ) $.
tendoset.e $e |- E = ( ( TEndo ` K ) ` W ) $.
istendod.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. V /\ W e. H ) ) $.
istendod.2 $e |- ( ph -> S : T --> T ) $.
istendod.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. T /\ g e. T ) -> ( S ` ( f o. g ) ) = ( ( S ` f ) o. ( S ` g ) ) ) $.
istendod.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. T ) -> ( R ` ( S ` f ) ) .<_ ( R ` f ) ) $.
istendod $p |- ( ph -> S e. E ) $.
$d .<_ f $.
$d K f g $.
$d R f $.
$d S f g $.
$d T f g $.
$d W f g $.
$d f g ph $.
